appearances.snippet: >> well, there's a reason that chuck grassley, whose name is often synonymous with oversight and whistleblowers was not on that letter. and the situation in the senate is that there's a big gap between where the republican concern is about trump's misbehavior and what they're willing to say publicly to create a potential confrontation with trump. i mean, they saw what happened to joni ernst, for instance, when she was a possible no vote for pete hegseth. and i think they're very anxious to not get in the way of trump's gang of more or less political thugs who will do everything they can to ruin their lives if they step out of line. but underneath that is brewing discontent that we see more and more and more. >> certainly with more and more reporting coming out. and as you mentioned, also going into an election year, those calculations might change for some of those politicians. senator sheldon whitehouse, thank you so much. great to have you with us, sir. appreciate it. >> thank you. >> i want to bring into the conversation legal analyst barbara mcquade. she is a former u.s. attorney and now a

appearances.title: Way Too Early With Ali Vitali : MSNOW : January 6, 2026 2:00am-3:01am PST
appearances.snippet: in a rare bipartisan joint statement, committee leaders chuck grassley and dick durbin said in part, quote, there is no legitimate basis for excluding the senate judiciary committee from this briefing. the administration's refusal to acknowledge our committee's indisputable jurisdiction in this matter is unacceptable. we'll see if they push for more there, though. i think the expectation is that a wider circle of members will be briefed in the coming days or potentially weeks. republican senator rand paul, though, criticized president trump's raid in venezuela and the seizing of president maduro during an interview with reporters on the hill yesterday. paul blamed republican senator lindsey graham of south carolina for changing trump's views on foreign policy, which paul said were originally against regime change and nation building. watch. >> it was something i liked about donald trump. it was one of the things, whenever i had misgivings about something else, i would always come back and say, well, he's the best we've ever had, much better than the bushes who are war mad and wanted
